private_information: Top-to-bottom on left peg: A, B, C, D
I control the left peg and can move its top disk if a legal move exists
left_peg_agent.goal: Move all disks from left peg to right peg maintaining legal moves

private_information: I control the middle peg and can receive or send disks subject to legal moves
middle_peg_agent.goal: Move all disks from left peg to right peg maintaining legal moves

private_information: I control the right peg and can receive disks subject to legal moves
right_peg_agent.goal: Move all disks from left peg to right peg maintaining legal moves

orchestrator.goal: Move all disks from left peg to right peg maintaining legal moves

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, right.
There are four disks labeled A (smallest), B, C, D (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: right peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D; left peg empty; middle peg empty.

report.system_prompt: You are the left peg agent. Provide a concise plain-text description of the local state of your peg and any relevant constraints. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->left_peg_agent->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->left_peg_agent->goal} Provide a short state report describing your peg and the disks on it, and mention any local constraints you observe.

report.system_prompt: You are the middle peg agent. Provide a concise plain-text description of the local state of your peg and any relevant constraints. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->middle_peg_agent->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->middle_peg_agent->goal} Provide a short state report describing your peg and the disks on it, and mention any local constraints you observe.

report.system_prompt: You are the right peg agent. Provide a concise plain-text description of the local state of your peg and any relevant constraints. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is right_peg_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->right_peg_agent->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->right_peg_agent->goal} Provide a short state report describing your peg and the disks on it, and mention any local constraints you observe.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and planning for the FastDownwards solver. Using the peg agents' state reports as authoritative initial state, produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that represent this Tower of Hanoi instance. The domain and problem must encode pegs left, middle, right and disks A B C D, allow only one-disk moves, and enforce that no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk. Target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not include extraneous commentary.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the state reports from the three peg agents and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownwards that achieves the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Use the following reports as inputs: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right} Provide the final PDDL domain and problem enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
